content.description: Start low on ledge and work your way up hanging and using feet for anchor.
content.location:
Located just South of Warhol and Secret Sandbox. 

  Latitude: 41° 7' 25.52" N   Longitude: 81° 30' 25.428" W

content.description: The crux comes after the crack begins to peter out, before you get established on the crimps up on the headwall. You should be extremely comfortable in the grade if you plan to boulder this, otherwise you can string up a top rope for the route.
content.protection: A few pads and a good spotter. Or a top rope.
content.location: On the Gorge side of the park approach from the trail after reaching the dam before the bridge head up (right) the path along shale river bed. You will reach a large cave that perpetually seeps, the boulder is on climbers right side of the cave.

content.description: The crux is near the top, getting the correct hands and comfortably downclimbing or falling.
content.protection: a few pads and a spotter
content.location: Same approach as With Momma I can fly.

content.description: This is a fun boulder problem with close resemblance to "Where the Sidewalk Ends".
content.location:
Located just South of the South Face.   

  Latitude: 41° 7' 25.14" N   Longitude: 81° 30' 20.742" W

content.description:
Bouldering route to the left of Secret Sandbox.   

  Simple green (VB): traverse left to right moving around arete then finish on far right at ledge.   

  Immaculate Mary (V1+): low start with left hand side pull, right hand to small crimp ledge, traverse right, feet on ledge, heel hook to finish on right ledge.
content.location: Warhol is small bouldering area located on the west portion of Secret Sandbox Cave (left portion when looking at the Secret Sandbox).

content.description: This is a nice bouldering traverse for beginners or when your arms are tired from the other problems in Secret Sandbox.
content.location:
Just east of Donatello.  

  Latitude: 41° 7' 25.66" N   Longitude: 81° 30' 22.362" W

content.description: Tougher traverse going over small cave.
content.location: Latitude: 41° 7' 26.2" N   Longitude: 81° 30' 18.372" W

content.description: Short traverse with lots of options.

content.description:
A moderately difficult traverse.  Start is easy, Krak is tougher.

content.location: This is the South Face of the rock (opposite to the "North Face").  In the corer of South Face is the "Krak"

content.description: Not sure.
content.location:
Located just East of Notebook. 

  Latitude: 41° 7' 26.59" N   Longitude: 81° 30' 15.66" W

content.description: Secret sandbox cave is one of the many bouldering spots in Gorge.  It has a lot of traverse bouldering options.  The length of the ledge is about 200 or 300 feet and about 20 to 30 feet high.  It is south facing and gets a lot of sun.  Most parts closer to the ground are dry and without moss.
content.location: This route is off the beaten path on the west end of Gorge Metro Park.

content.description: This is a boulder problem just adjacent to Batman.  Starts easy using feet, then a dyno brings you to the end.
content.location:
Just adjacent to Batman. 

  Latitude: 41° 7' 25.92" N   Longitude: 81° 30' 26.31" W

content.description: Nice upward traverse.
content.location:
Located just around the corner from Walk in the Park. 

  Latitude: 41° 7' 26.48" N   Longitude: 81° 30' 19.86" W

content.description: Krak is located in the middle of the South Face.  This is a nice warm spot to climb protected from wind if it is a cold day.

Located in the middle portion of South Face.

content.description: Gamma Ray is a 50 foot traverse in the center portion of the Secret Sandbox.  The crux is a move to transition from the middle portion pulling a crimp up high with a long reach with your feet to the end.
content.location:
Gamma Ray is located just East of "Warhol" traverse route. 

  Latitude: 41° 7' 25.89" N   Longitude: 81° 30' 24.252" W

content.description: Batman is a boulder problem just West of Zorton.  It is named after the small "bat cave" in the center.  Start low and then go high above the cave.
content.location:
Located just adjacent to Robin. 

  Latitude: 41° 7' 25.92" N   Longitude: 81° 30' 26.31" W

content.description:
Gorge is located in Cuyahoga Falls, OH has plenty of rock ledges to see in North East Ohio.  The rock is sandstone.  Almost all of the ledges are south facing and thus in many areas are quite dry and without any mosses / plant growth.  There are zero routes officially marked.   

  There are no official camping spots in the park and no fees to enter.  Alcoholic beverages of any kind are forbidden in the park.  Do not bring them for any reason.   

  Please do not touch rocks with moss or lichens on it.  These are important for the wildlife and need to be protected.  Stick to areas that are dry and without growth and directly adjacent to the path (walking off the path is not permitted).  This park is great for hiking to see the rocks and many rock overhangs.  It has two pretty nice waterfalls.  Also, the "Highbridge Glens" trail has some spectacular views of the river.  The Cuyahoga River runs through it and if you are ambitious, you can take a kayak down there and ride the river.    

  Secret Sandbox and South Face (Krak) are both relatively dry overhang areas off the beaten path and nice place to start.  South facing sun with a lot of dry rock underneath the overhang.  There are also numerous other places to see nice rock faces in the park.  Choose your own adventure and tread lightly.   

  Gorge has a main entrance area that can be found easily on Google.  The rock ledges begin near the entrance and go all the way to where the Gorge goes under State Rd. bridge.  There is another entrance that is a bit hidden on the East side of the State Rd. Bridge.  This is quickly accessible and gets you to the rocks quickly.  I recommend searching the location on Google. 

  Nearby places to eat / drink:   Before or after you hike, make a visit to Blue Door Cafe and Bakery located at 1970 State Rd., Cuyahoga Falls, OH.  This is one of the best cafes in a 100 mile radius of the area!  Super fresh made bread and great food, but check hours to make sure they are open bluedoorcafebakery.com.  You may also like to try another nearby cafe (walkable distance from Gorge, fluryscafe.com/).  This has some nice breakfast and early afternoon lunch.  Also, "The Office", "Craft Beer Bar" near downtown Cuyahoga Falls are nice for an after hike dinner / beer.  Burntwood Tavern in Downtown Cuyahoga Falls has an awesome patio overlooking the Cuyahoga River and great craft beers to choose from.
